cards.rules_text:
{W}{U} DESTINY Your creatures are meant for more. Seek their destiny and thrive.
{U}{B} TAPPING Your coven of witches can conjure powerful magic together through tap effects.
{B}{R} SPIRITS Call upon the Aos Si of the Otherworld and lead a Spirit army.
{R}{G} RAID Go forth, warrior, and conquer. Attack and reap the benefits.
{G}{W} ATTACK Lead an army and benefit when you attack with three or more creatures.
{W}{B} OATHS Your word is sacred. Stick to your sworn Oaths and be rewarded.
{B}{G} LIFEGAIN Seek immortality, or at least seek to outlast your opponents.
{G}{U} STRENGTH Only the strongest can reach the top. Focus on power 4 or greater and let might make right.
{U}{R} TACTICS Manage your attacks with support: Vehicles, abilities, and combat tricks will see you succeed.
{R}{W} GRAVEYARD The memories of the dead will lead you to victory; use your graveyard as a resource to win.[i]
Solemn Caoineag gets +1/+0 as long as you've gained life this turn.
cards.flavor_text: [i]The sorrowful weeping of the caoineag is a portent of coming death on the field of battle.[/i]

cards.rules_text: Whenever Hawthorn Witch becomes tapped, each opponent loses 1 life and you gain 1 life.
When Mournful Muse enters the battlefield, each opponent discards a card.
cards.flavor_text: [i]Tragic bards and poets may be haunted by the leannan, who thrives on their inspiration and imagination, pushing them to new feats of skill while draining their energies.[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Relentless Galloglas can't block.
{2}{B}: Return Relentless Galloglas from your graveyard to the battlefield.
When An-Drim Brigand enters the battlefield, it swears an Oath. [i](Reveal an Oath you own from outside the game and put it into your hand, or put a +1/+1 counter on this creature.)[/i]
{2}, {T}: Target player loses 2 life. Activate only if you own two or more cards in exile.
cards.flavor_text: [i]Horse skulls, dried cats, and scattered salt; no ward is strong enough to protect from the witch's hexes.[/i]

cards.rules_text: When Loathsome Dullahan dies, each opponent loses 2 life and you gain 2 life.

When Ar Dacha Bloodletter enters the battlefield, it swears an Oath. [i](Reveal an Oath you own from outside the game and put it into your hand, or put a +1/+1 counter on this creature.)[/i]
Ar Dacha Bloodletter has menace as long as it has a +1/+1 counter on it.
When Monarch of Night enters the battlefield, if you control two or more other Spirits, up to one target creature gets -2/-2 until end of turn. If that creature would die this turn, exile it instead.
When Night-Wreathed Raider enters the battlefield, if you've gained 3 or more life this turn, each opponent loses 3 life. Otherwise, each opponent loses 1 life and you gain 1 life.

Vigilance
Tur Aun Rover enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it as long as you've gained life this turn.
cards.flavor_text: [i]In the plains of Tur Aun, beyond the town walls of Ó Maha, it pays to have eyes in the back of your head.[/i]

cards.rules_text: At the beginning of your upkeep, if you control another creature with power 4 or greater, you gain 1 life.
When Inspiring Brigand dies, create a 2/2 green and white Human Warrior creature token.
cards.flavor_text: [i]Some legends are passed down from generation to generation over hearth fires; others must be seen on the field of battle to be remembered.[/i]

cards.rules_text: [i]Raid[/i] — This spell costs {1} less to cast if you attacked this turn.
cards.flavor_text: [i]The rugged landscape of Fehr Maun breeds hardy and practical warriors, eager to taste the thrill of battle.[/i]

cards.rules_text: Duun Raider has haste as long as you control another creature with power 4 or greater.
cards.flavor_text: [i]“Strike fast, strike well, and be gone before your last arrow lands.”[/i]

cards.rules_text:

Whenever you attack with three or more creatures, add {G}. Until end of turn, you don't lose this mana as step and phases end.

Whenever Ornery Badger becomes blocked, it gets +3/+3 until end of turn.

When Wolftamer enters the battlefield, create a 2/2 green Wolf creature token, then you gain 1 life for each Wolf you control.

cards.rules_text: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn for each counter on it.
cards.flavor_text: [i]It takes a strong will and the favor of the gods to carve one's name into history forever.[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Enchant creature
When Púca's Blessing enters the battlefield, draw a card.
Whenever a card you own is put into exile, put a +1/+1 counter on enchanted creature. This ability triggers only once per turn.

At the beginning of your end step, if you control two or more untapped creatures, Oath of Penance is fulfilled.
When Oath of Penance is fulfilled, exile it and distribute two +1/+1 counters among one or two target creatures.

At the beginning of your end step, if you attacked with creatures with total power 3 or more this turn, Oath of Purity is fulfilled.
When Oath of Purity is fulfilled, exile it and destroy up to one target artifact or enchantment.

cards.flavor_text: [i]The rolling plains of Ar Dacha give way to rich farmland, lending it the epithet of the Orchard Kingdom.[/i]
[i]The kingdom of An-Drim spans the coast of Ulaith, and is home to great cities blessed by the sea god Annan.[/i]
[i]The moors and fens of Tur Aun crawl with the witches of the Bloody Handed One, their altars pockmarking the land.[/i]
[i]The high cliffs of Duun make it the perfect location for fortifications—and for bandits' lairs.[/i]
[i]The deep woods of Fehr Maun permit no sunlight to reach the ground, and have long been home to wild magicks.[/i]

cards.rules_text:

Target opponent takes an extra turn after this one. That player skips the combat phase of that turn.
At the beginning of your next upkeep, take an extra turn after that one. The first time you attack during that turn, untap all creatures you control and there is an additional combat phase after that phase.

Players can't win the game unless a source they control has dealt combat damage to a player this turn.
Players can't lose the game unless they have been dealt combat damage this turn.
Each creature you control has vigilance and can block an additional creature each combat.

cards.flavor_text: [i]The wandering god Unell is seen as an exemplary hero, moving from adventure to adventure without ever slowing. His followers likewise seek out new glories and greater triumphs.[/i]
[i]Luth, god of craftwork and culture, is an ill-tempered but creative being, never content with his work. Those who invoke him are thus inspired never to rest on their own laurels either.[/i]
[i]Capal Dú, the black horse, is king of the gods not by respect but through fear. His name is not uttered lightly and he is less worshipped than appeased throughout Ulaith.[/i]

[i]Annan, the voyager, god of seas and of the Otherworld, is an ephemeral trickster, delighting in the unknowable nature of his twin realms. Those who call on him do so to ward against his own caprices as much as any other fate.[/i]

[i]Rigann, god of death and fate, measures the life of each of soul on Ulaith. She is a fickle master, and though many swear fealty to her, it is her great delight to trip warriors up in conflicting oaths and broken promises.[/i]
